instruction: Create a Blueprint with a boolean variable IsActive. On BeginPlay, use a Branch node to check IsActive. If true, print Active. If false, print Inactive.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_BranchCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsActive: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=IsActive]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Active"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Inactive"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n5.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_BranchCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsActive: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=IsActive]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Active"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Inactive"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n5.Execute>
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_BranchCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsActive: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=IsActive]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Active"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Inactive"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n5.Execute>

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on overlap checks if the overlapping actor has the tag Enemy. If yes, print Danger. If no, print Safe.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TagBranch
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: ActorHasTag [Tag="Enemy"]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Danger"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Safe"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Target [Actor]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n5.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CheckEnemy
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: Branch
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="Danger"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Safe"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.True -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.False -> n4.Execute {

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a float variable Health starting at 100.0. On Event AnyDamage, subtract the damage amount from Health and set the new value.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_HealthTracker
PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 100.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_AnyDamage
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Health]
NODE n3: Subtract
NODE n4: VariableSet [VarName=Health]
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n1.Damage -> n3.B [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Value [Float]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DamagedHealth
PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 100.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_AnyDamage
NODE n2: GetVar [Variable=Health]
NODE n3: SubtractFloat
NODE n4: SetVar [Variable=Health]
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n1.DamageAmount -> n3.B [Float]
DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Value [Float] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DamagedHealth
PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 100.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_AnyDamage
NODE n2: GetVar [Variable=Health]
NODE n3: SubtractFloat
NODE n4: SetVar [Variable=Health]
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n1.DamageAmount -> n3.B [Float]
DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Value [Float] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a custom event called OnActivate. On BeginPlay, call the custom event OnActivate. The OnActivate event prints Activated.

NODE n2: CallEvent [EventName=OnActivate]

EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a Gate node. On BeginPlay, open the gate. When the player presses the Fire input action, the gate filters execution to print Firing.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GateExample
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Gate
NODE n3: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Firing"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Open
EXEC n3.Pressed -> n2.Enter
EXEC n2.Exit -> n4.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GateFilter
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Gate
NODE n3: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Firing"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Open
EXEC n3.Pressed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n2.Exit -> n4.Execute }

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Open

EXEC n2.Exit -> n4.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint where pressing Interact opens a gate and pressing Fire enters the gate to toggle visibility.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GateToggle
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: Gate
NODE n3: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n4: ToggleVisibility
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Open
EXEC n3.Pressed -> n2.Enter
EXEC n2.Exit -> n4.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleVisibility
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
VAR bIsVisible: Bool = true
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: Gate
NODE n3: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n4: SetVisibility [Target=Self, NewVisibility=true]
NODE n5: SetVisibility [Target=Self, NewVisibility=false]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Open
EXEC n3.Pressed -> n2.Enter
EXEC n2.Exit -> n4.Execute
EXEC n2.Exit -> n5.Execute>
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleVisibility
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
VAR bIsVisible: Bool = true
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: Gate
NODE n3: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n4: SetVisibility [Target=Self, NewVisibility=true]
NODE n5: SetVisibility [Target=Self, NewVisibility=false]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Open
EXEC n3.Pressed -> n2.Enter
EXEC n2.Exit -> n4.Execute
EXEC n2.Exit -> n5.Execute>

instruction: Create a Blueprint that spawns a projectile actor at the player's location when the Fire input is pressed.

NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Projectile]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.SpawnTransform [Transform]

NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=ProjectileClass]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.SpawnTransform [Transform]);

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay spawns 3 enemy actors using a ForEachLoop over an array.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SpawnEnemies
PARENT: Actor
VAR SpawnPoints: Array<Vector>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=SpawnPoints]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Enemy]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.SpawnTransform [Transform]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SpawnEnemies
PARENT: Actor
VAR Enemies: Array<ActorClass>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Enemies]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: SpawnActorFromClass
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.ActorClass [ActorClass] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SpawnEnemies
PARENT: Actor
VAR Enemies: Array<ActorClass>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Enemies]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: SpawnActorFromClass
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.ActorClass [ActorClass] }

DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.OtherActor [Actor]

DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick checks distance to the player. If less than 200, print Near. If more than 1000, print Far.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_NearFar
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetPlayerPawn
NODE n3: GetDistanceTo
NODE n4: LessThan [B=200.0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Near"]
NODE n7: GreaterThan [B=1000.0]
NODE n8: Branch
NODE n9: PrintString [InString="Far"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
EXEC n5.False -> n8.Execute
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n7.A [Float]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n8.True -> n9.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DistanceCheck
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
VAR DistanceToPlayer: Float = 0.0
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: GetPlayerPawn
NODE n4: GetActorLocation
NODE n5: Vector_Distance
NODE n6: LessEqualFloat [B=200.0]
NODE n7: GreaterThanFloat [B=1000.0]
NODE n8: Branch
NODE n9: PrintString [InString="Near"]
NODE n10: PrintString [InString="Far"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n8.Execute
EXEC n8.True -> n9.Execute
EXEC n8.False -> n10.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n5.A [Vector]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Target [Actor]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.B [Vector]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.A [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n8.Condition [Bool]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n7.A [Float]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.Condition [Bool] }

CATEGORY: Gameplay

instruction: Create a Blueprint that toggles visibility each time the player presses Interact. Use a FlipFlop and SetVisibility nodes.

EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute

actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleVis
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
VAR bIsVisible: Bool = true
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetVisibility [Target=MeshComponent, NewVisibility=true]
NODE n4: SetVisibility [Target=MeshComponent, NewVisibility=false]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleVis
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
VAR bIsVisible: Bool = true
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetVisibility [Target=MeshComponent, NewVisibility=true]
NODE n4: SetVisibility [Target=MeshComponent, NewVisibility=false]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute }

EXEC n2.Then_1 -> n4.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_2 -> n5.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick adds a rotation of 1.0 on the Yaw axis to make the actor spin continuously.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Spinner
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: AddActorLocalRotation [DeltaRotation=(Pitch=0.0,Yaw=1.0,Roll=0.0)]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Spinner
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorRotation
NODE n3: MakeRotator [Yaw=1.0]
NODE n4: AddActorLocalRotation
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Rotation [Rotator]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.DeltaRotation [Rotator] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Spinner
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorRotation
NODE n3: MakeRotator [Yaw=1.0]
NODE n4: AddActorLocalRotation
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Rotation [Rotator]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.DeltaRotation [Rotator] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that when another actor overlaps, prints the name of the overlapping actor using GetDisplayName.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_PrintOverlapper
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: GetDisplayName
NODE n3: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Target [Actor]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.InString [String]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_OverlapPrint
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: GetDisplayName

DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Target [Actor]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.InString [String] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that plays a sound at the actor's location when BeginPlay fires. Use PlaySoundAtLocation.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_PlayStartSound
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: PlaySoundAtLocation [Sound=StartSound]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Location [Vector]

GRAPH: EventGraph

DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Location [Vector] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay multiplies 5 times 10, adds 25, and prints the result.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_MathChain
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Multiply [A=5, B=10]
NODE n3: Add [A=0, B=25]
NODE n4: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.InString [String]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_MathExample
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: MultiplyFloat [A=5, B=10]
NODE n3: AddFloat [B=25]
NODE n4: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.InString [String] {

instruction: Create a Blueprint with three events: BeginPlay prints Ready, pressing Jump prints Jumped, and on overlap prints Touched.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ThreeEvents
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Ready"]
NODE n3: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Jump"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Jumped"]
NODE n5: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Touched"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Pressed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ThreeEvents
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Ready"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
NODE n3: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Jump"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Jumped"]
EXEC n3.Pressed -> n4.Execute
NODE n5: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Touched"]
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute }
raw_output:

PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Ready"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
NODE n3: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Jump"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Jumped"]
EXEC n3.Pressed -> n4.Execute
NODE n5: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Touched"]
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute }
